job_title: Environmental Service Associate in Towson, MD
pros: Okay benefits, you can work OT, you’re part of a union (although I don’t understand purpose but people say it’s great), guaranteed work
cons: Management is nasty, ridiculous and unorganized. A write up lasts a YEAR. Get that union rep involved immediately!! Nurses, doctors, CNA’s etc think you’re beneath them and verbally remind you with slick comments even though they’re dirtier than the patients. They will step on your freshly mopped floor and not even greet you. They will try to flush tampons and throw trash on the floor even if it’s two trash cans in one room. Anybody sees you sitting down and they will assume you don’t do anything all day even if you’ve done everything you need to do or get up if you’re requested to do something. They claim EVS is the backbone of the building but remind you that you’re nothing any chance they get. 95% of the employees don’t mind their business and think if you don’t entertain gossip you're unapproachable. Drama for no reason, they act like it’s greys anatomy

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Towson, MD
pros: Everyone is helpful and their is a great friendly environment that will make you easily feel like your apart of a family. Lots of overtime available, you get to make your own schedule. Only required to work at minimum 3 days a week, they have 8 and 12 hour shifts available. They recently started a policy that everyone is required to work one weekend a month. Make sure your on time, 1 minute late is considered late and they have no grace period
cons:
No cons really, seems to be a shortage of techs at the moment (CNAs) but they have hiring surges every so often and bring new people in. 

I think they should raise the rate of pay for techs, they rely alot on them and expect so much from them

review_title: Friendly staff, not great pay or opportunities for advancement

pros: Great Care of PATIENTS and Community
cons: The Human Resources Department needs to learn how to practice what they preach; meaning act how you advise management to act. People inside and outside of the department are watching and talking. It's particularly funny how an employee in HR recently was offered an increase to stay out of desperation, however the offer has caused friction amongst those "in the know".  I get it, people are leaving in droves, however why hasn't leadership looked into this. There has been 30+ people who has left over the past few years and trust me it's not due to COVID or wanting to work from home, etc. It's all based on treatment!!!

review_title: Good Place to work for stability, not career path oriented.
job_title: IT Business Systems Manager in Baltimore, MD
pros: Very dedicated to healthcare and to implementing and practicing Lean Management in service of healthcare delivery. The people are generally authentic to the mission and it is a rewarding place to work. Benefits are Excellent.
cons: Not at all dedicated to practicing Lean Management for the support functions like Finance or HR. Policies are not really followed through on, so it's pretty chaotic. Terrible project management. Very disorganized leadership. Career paths for non-medical staff are borderline non-existent. Performance management system is highly ineffective.

pros: Supportive environment, leadership was accessible, collaboration was emphasized

Lean management philosophy

review_title: Emergency Room Is Absolutely Horrible and Racist
pros: Awesome health insurance benefits. I was there for years all managers had your back except for one manager.
cons: Little potential to none for growth to a management position unless you are friends with upper management. I have seen highly qualified multiple degrees holding individuals passed over for "friends of management" whom were not even qualified and or educated. Managers and Directors are racist ( I was in management and witnessed this first hand). Nursing definitely needs more sensitivity and ethics training. Security sleeps most shifts when they are not openly flirting with staff. Managers pick and choose which staff members to enforce the rules with. I have witnessed a few pediatric ER nursing staff members as well as the Adult ED staff treat other hospital disciplines as if they were garbage. The (ER) “C -Level Exec” was the most dreadful and arrogant person to work with and further encourages the bad behaviors of the nursing department.

pros: Beautiful campus, easy commute, free parking, competitive pay, and for the most part, coworkers who are helpful and hardworking. There is a healthy culture of safety within the hospital regarding incident reporting; it is very much encouraged and has always been handled professionally by leadership on the unit.
cons: Poor staffing, lack of policies, employee favoritism from management, and a lack of security. The hospital does not require visitors to "Sign In" upon entrance. There are "officers" stationed at the L&D entrance as well as on foot throughout the hospital, however the main entrance is left unlocked and unattended overnight after 7pm. At any point after this time, a person can enter the hospital freely to access employees, patient rooms, and any of the non-locked units.

pros: Nimble administration, capable to make quick changes, committed to providing excellent patient care. The hospital also cares that their staff are happy.
cons: Understaffed the last couple of years due to rapid turnover of physicians leading to increased stress and reduced morale among the staff.

pros: Has a very good vision statement, the organization needs to take their vision and treat employees the same. Maybe they should change the vision statement from "Treat every patient as if they were a family member" to "Do unto others as you would like done to yourself"
cons:
Cannot speak up without retaliation!
 Leadership titles such as VP and others given to people who do not have a degree. What organization do you know that a Masters Degree is not required for a VP position, well go to GBMC and you may have a chance. But wait, it is not what you know it is who you know. 
Dictatorship, many silos, one person or department does not know what the other is doing.   No advancement!!

pros: I have none if was a second job for me.
cons: Their not open to new people the staff has been there forever. There is no diversity it's Black or White they don't like it you're out spoken. The salary sucks, their not dirty coming with information. If the older staff feels you're not doing things to their liking they  run tell management. You get pulled in the office there is not a updated system for putting in for vacation. If you have no device years in don't expect to get vacation you will be the last to put in for it. They start you out at 13.25 and your because their union management sucks awful. They have these nurse's lvl 3 and 4 managing the staff and they don't know how to speak to people. It's a very clickish place to work. Beware of the Postpartum unit they only want a door keeper to mind the door the charge nurse's don't care if you get a break, eat, use the bathroom  etc. Please beware of this unit and know their not friendly staff.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Baltimore, MD
pros: What makes GBMC so great is that it is one of the few remaining not-for- profit community hospitals that exist within modern society that genuinely evokes a sense of compassion and comradery amongst it's staff; and the community. Being that it is not your large scale industrial big name hospital, GBMC is the kind of place where you slowly develop those special and close personal relationships with everyone from the cafeteria worker to your fellow RN colleagues to your supervisor. It is one of the least punitive health care environments I have had the pleasure to work in, where instead of persistently scrutinizing and discouraging employees, they focus on ways in which an individual may improve and implement plans to improve accordingly.
cons: This is not exactly the ideal hospital to work at if you are looking for experience in more action packed high acuity areas such as shock trauma or advanced cardio-invasive intervention as this hospitals acuity level does not accommodate those cases at this time. The hospital is also not as technologically advanced as others in the surrounding metro area.

pros: Great staff and management. Managers work with you to make sure you have training and equipment needed as well as being flexible. They do expect a lot from you but at same time realize hard work put in and reward it.
cons: I love working here because I am busy all the time and day flies by. If you're not good at doing multitasking, this is not the place for you. There are other places you can coast by in, this is not one of them. That's a positive for me but some others may not like it.

pros: One of the reasons why I like being employed at  (GBMC)  is because of the closeness of care and concern that the employees demonstrate to the patients. (GBMC) value their patients in every area of the their lives where their privacy, safety, and care are all respected by the healthcare facility.
cons: Well I'm not sure of any downsides at this time, because the vast majority of the employees has demonstrated a positive outlook and atmosphere where one can work in a healthy environment and most importantly, as a team.

pros: company cares about me. great benefit. (costly). parking free. allows time to give great pt. care. The assignments are reasonable . very clean too.
cons: the industry in general is more diff. today. we offer" room service " when pt's order their food. they can order anytime . the diabetics order their proper diet only. unfortunately it can be at anytime. hard to get a finger stick at a appropriate time  .

review_title: long enough to see how it works
pros: Decent wages. CEO  is engaging and visible.
cons: Leadership in select departments will not hesitate to boldly practice shameless (lying) behavior in order to falsely appease  insecure unqualified execs. Any complaints, don't bother bringing them to HR. Their interest lies in securing their position at GBMC.  Diversity in leadership is transient at best or non-existent.

review_title: This used to be a great place to work
pros: No assigned uniforms......YET. My co workers are amazing and when you have to work under staffed that means a lot. Also the parking is free too employees however all employee parking areas are inconvenient and force some people to leave 15-20 minutes earlier just to clock in on time. But hey its free, I guess.
cons: Management is horrible, there is a lot of favoritism. Pay is low in comparison to other hospitals. Employees aren't valued or even equal to other employees. Chain of command is pretty non existent. If you have a problem on your unit everything is at the "managers discretion" and if your manager is the problem there is pretty much nothing you can do but switch units. Even then it's up to your manager if you can go. Management does all the wrong things to stay on to budget to ensure they get their annual bonuses, like making you work under staffed and use the most outdated equipment possible. That's assuming you have the proper equipment in the first place. If not then you have to beg, borrow or steal from other units. This is such a problem that most units have to practically horde supplies and aren't even willing to share. I used to love coming to work everyday but now it's just miserable. Also considering that this is a hospital the benefits are terrible!!! Super expensive especially if you want a out of hospital doctor. Which I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!  Worst doctors I've ever worked with. Incompetent and just flat out rude. I've only stayed this long because I love my co workers but now I'm ready to leave asap.

pros: There are some great people working within the system. I love the culture of caring for our patients. My department is phenomenal!!!
cons: HR department  needs a complete overhaul!  Salaries are too low; can't attain quality staff. Leadership does not care enough about the employees. There's  complete burnout! Too many clicks and favoritism. leadership never really listens to what the employees have to say. The Employee engagement  survey is a complete  waste of time!!!

review_title: Nice, place to work - but little opportunity for advancement
pros: Generally people are very friendly. Teams seem to get along well and work well with other departments. Most employees seem relatively happy.
cons: Upper management out of touch with most "front line" issues. Many projects are launched to placate doctors egos, rather than drive business goals. Very limited opportunity for advancement. No career pathing unless you are part of an elite few.

pros: It is in a good neighborhood
cons: nursing staff was like dealing with a high school clique.  Not very welcoming or friendly.  I felt made fun of, and unaccepted.

pros: A great atmosphere; majority of the entire staff are rather friendly and easy to talk to and to get along with.
cons: Alot of favoritism; depending on what department you are in; will determine room for growth (promotion). Immediate supervisors are NOT professional 85% of the time; they tend to do things based off conviency for them.

job_title: High School Student Summer Volunteer in Baltimore, MD
pros: Every one of the staff that I interacted with was friendly, happy to give me work to do, and willing to explain what it is that they did and why -- wonderful for an inquisitive and aspiring volunteer.
cons: Many of the menial jobs are boring and don't feel useful -- either in the moment or when you're recounting them to later employers.

pros:
there is a friendly staff
they have nice atmosphere
they also have good pay

pros: It is a pleasant place to work . Everyone is so friendly and willing to help you if you need the help .
cons: Communication needs to be more open and more help is needed where as just a hand full of people should not have to work so hard .

pros: Seeing the same patients all the time and the connection with them. As well as working alongside the nurses was a great experience

cons: Pace it a little slow moving if you are not used to it. Hard to get things done sometimes with management. Not a lot of chance for advancement on the non-clinical side. Employee incentive plan is pretty much a joke.

pros: Team Work and Welcoming

review_title: GBMC is one company that doesn't care about its employees.

job_title: Inpatient Physician Assistant I in Towson, MD
pros: It's a beautiful campus. Walking trails on campus. Parking is free. Close to Towson and the beltway, I-83. Health incentives for discounts on benefits.
cons:
Do not value PA/NP cohorts. Physicians seem resistant to the presence of PA/NP's 
I received a nurses week journal during nurses week, but no mention of PAs during PA week.
